supply_logistics.supply_status: Q2 1941 Status: Division in TRANSITION phase. April-May: Training and preparation in South Africa at Voortrekkerhoogte. June: Deployed to Egypt via sea transport. End June-August: Stationed near El Alamein for desert warfare training and defensive works construction. Supply state: Adequate for training operations. Post-deployment (late June): Establishing supply lines from Egyptian depots. Division not yet operationally deployed in combat.

weather_environment.season_quarter: 1941-Q2 (April-June) - SPLIT ENVIRONMENT: April-May (South Africa - winter approaching, mild), Late June-August (Egypt - summer heat, Western Desert near El Alamein)
weather_environment.terrain_type: TRANSITIONAL: South Africa training areas (temperate, varied terrain) â†’ Western Desert Egypt (arid, sandy, coastal near El Alamein). Division undergoing desert warfare training late June onwards.

subordinate_units.note: Battalions (as of Sept 1941 arrival in theater): 1st Imperial Light Horse, 1st Royal Durban Light Infantry, 1st Kaffrarian Rifles, B & C Companies Die Middelandse Regiment. Q2 1941: Likely in formation/training.
Battalions: 2nd Royal Durban Light Infantry, Umvoti Mounted Rifles, Kaffrarian Rifles, Blake Group (composite battalion ex-1st SA Div). Q2 1941: In formation/training.
Battalions: 1st SA Police Battalion, 2nd SA Police Battalion, 2nd Transvaal Scottish Regiment. Q2 1941: In formation/training.

tactical_doctrine.role: Commonwealth infantry division in TRANSITION to Western Desert operations. Q2 1941 mission: April-May (training in South Africa for North African deployment), June (sea deployment to Egypt), late June-August (desert warfare training at El Alamein, defensive works construction). Division formed October 23, 1940 under Maj-Gen de Villiers. NOT operationally deployed in combat during Q2 1941.
special_capabilities: Motorized infantry division with good mobility
tactical_innovations: Integration of SA Police battalions (6th Brigade)
known_issues: Division NOT combat-ready in Q2 1941 - still training/deploying
Desert warfare training incomplete during Q2 1941
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: IN PROGRESS (late June 1941 onwards): Division arrived Egypt late June, began desert warfare training at El Alamein. Adaptations being implemented: water discipline, desert navigation, vehicle sand modifications. Full operational readiness achieved September 1941.

scenario_suitability: Desert warfare training (late June-August 1941 El Alamein area)
NOT suitable for combat scenarios in Q2 1941 (division not operationally deployed)
Suitable for later scenarios: Operation Crusader (Nov 1941-Jan 1942), Battle of Bardia (Dec 31, 1941 - Jan 2, 1942)
special_rules: Training status Q2 1941 (not combat-ready until September 1941)
South African reconnaissance bonus (Marmon-Herrington armoured cars)
historical_engagements: Later engagements: Battle of Bardia (Dec 31, 1941 - Jan 2, 1942)
